thread.title: EXCLUSIVE: Buckeye Lake hotel for sale at reduced price
thread.title_full: EXCLUSIVE: Buckeye Lake hotel for sale at reduced price

author: Evan Weese
title: EXCLUSIVE: Buckeye Lake hotel for sale at reduced price
text:
Evan Weese Staff reporter Columbus Business First Evan Weese Staff reporter Columbus Business First The price has been reduced on an Econolodge in the Buckeye Lake area. The Econo Lodge one mile from the Buckeye Lake shore is for sale. Asking price for the 92-room Econolodge off Interstate 70 has been reduced to $1.3 million from $1.5 million, according to a listing on BizBuySell.com. The sale of the property at 10800 Hebron Road is not related to the Buckeye Lake dam fiasco that has kept water levels low and summer visitors at bay, said a representative of ownership group AS Hotels Inc., as well as listing agent Ray Massa of National Investment Realty LLC. “They’ve been talking about it for a year, (they) wanted to divest themselves of that,” Massa told me. The listing indicates the owner is “selling to obtain cash for another investment.” The 2.4-acre property and 34,114-square-foot building are valued at $1.58 million, according to the Licking County auditor’s site . 
Want Columbus Travel   Industries
